intro: Anthocleista kalbreyeri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical plant native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange to red berries. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Anthocleista kalbreyeri make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
